Question #274
âšª å•é€‰é¢˜ä¸­çº§
A company has an application that generates reports and stores them in an Amazon S3 bucket. When a user accesses their report, the application generates a signed URL to allow the user to download the report. The company's security team has discovered that the files are public and that anyone can download them without authentication. The company has suspended the generation of new reports until the problem is resolved. Which set of actions will immediately remediate the security issue without impacting the application's normal workflow?
ğŸ·ï¸ Knowledge Tags
AWS Services: S3Lambda
Knowledge Areas: å®‰å…¨æ€§å­˜å‚¨ç®¡ç†æƒé™æ§åˆ¶
Scenarios: æƒé™æ§åˆ¶æ•°æ®åŠ å¯†
Exam Domain: Domain3-è®¾è®¡å®‰å…¨åº”ç”¨å’Œæ¶æ„
Key Concepts: S3 Block Public Accesså¯¹è±¡ACLç­¾åURLå…¬å…±è®¿é—®æ§åˆ¶
A.
Create an AWS Lambda function that applies a deny all policy for users who are not authenticated. Create a scheduled event to invoke the Lambda function.
B.
Review the AWS Trusted Advisor bucket permissions check and implement the recommended actions.
C.
Run a script that puts a private ACL on all of the objects in the bucket.
D.
Use the Block Public Access feature in Amazon S3 to set the IgnorePublicACLs option to TRUE on the bucket.
ğŸ“– é¢˜ç›®ç¿»è¯‘
ä¸€å®¶å…¬å¸æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªåº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºç”ŸæˆæŠ¥å‘Šå¹¶å°†å…¶å­˜å‚¨åœ¨Amazon S3å­˜å‚¨æ¡¶ä¸­ã€‚å½“ç”¨æˆ·è®¿é—®å…¶æŠ¥å‘Šæ—¶ï¼Œåº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºç”Ÿæˆä¸€ä¸ªç­¾åURLä»¥å…è®¸ç”¨æˆ·ä¸‹è½½æŠ¥å‘Šã€‚å…¬å¸çš„å®‰å…¨å›¢é˜Ÿå‘ç°æ–‡ä»¶æ˜¯å…¬å¼€çš„ï¼Œä»»ä½•äººéƒ½å¯ä»¥åœ¨æ²¡æœ‰èº«ä»½éªŒè¯çš„æƒ…å†µä¸‹ä¸‹è½½å®ƒä»¬ã€‚å…¬å¸å·²æš‚åœç”Ÿæˆæ–°æŠ¥å‘Šç›´åˆ°é—®é¢˜è§£å†³ã€‚å“ªç»„æ“ä½œå°†ç«‹å³ä¿®å¤å®‰å…¨é—®é¢˜è€Œä¸å½±å“åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºçš„æ­£å¸¸å·¥ä½œæµç¨‹ï¼Ÿ
ğŸ”¤ é€‰é¡¹ç¿»è¯‘
A. åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªAWS Lambdaå‡½æ•°ï¼Œå¯¹æœªç»èº«ä»½éªŒè¯çš„ç”¨æˆ·åº”ç”¨æ‹’ç»æ‰€æœ‰ç­–ç•¥ã€‚åˆ›å»ºè®¡åˆ’äº‹ä»¶æ¥è°ƒç”¨Lambdaå‡½æ•°ã€‚ B. æŸ¥çœ‹AWS Trusted Advisorå­˜å‚¨æ¡¶æƒé™æ£€æŸ¥å¹¶å®æ–½æ¨èçš„æ“ä½œã€‚ C. è¿è¡Œè„šæœ¬ï¼Œå¯¹å­˜å‚¨æ¡¶ä¸­çš„æ‰€æœ‰å¯¹è±¡è®¾ç½®ç§æœ‰ACLã€‚ D. ä½¿ç”¨Amazon S3ä¸­çš„Block Public AccessåŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œå°†å­˜å‚¨æ¡¶çš„IgnorePublicACLsé€‰é¡¹è®¾ç½®ä¸ºTRUEã€‚
ğŸ¯ æ ¸å¿ƒè¦æ±‚
ç«‹å³é˜»æ­¢S3å¯¹è±¡çš„å…¬å…±è®¿é—®è€Œä¸å½±å“åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºä½¿ç”¨ç­¾åURLçš„æ­£å¸¸åŠŸèƒ½
âŒ é”™è¯¯é€‰é¡¹åˆ†æ
Aé€‰é¡¹è¿‡äºå¤æ‚ä¸”æ— æ³•ç›´æ¥è§£å†³ACLé—®é¢˜ï¼›Bé€‰é¡¹åªæ˜¯æ£€æŸ¥å·¥å…·ï¼Œä¸èƒ½ç«‹å³ä¿®å¤ï¼›Cé€‰é¡¹éœ€è¦é€ä¸ªä¿®æ”¹å¯¹è±¡ACLï¼Œæ•ˆç‡ä½ä¸”å¯èƒ½é—æ¼æ–°å¯¹è±¡ã€‚
âš–ï¸ å†³ç­–æ ‡å‡†
éœ€è¦ç«‹å³ç”Ÿæ•ˆã€ä¸å½±å“ç°æœ‰ç­¾åURLåŠŸèƒ½ã€èƒ½å¤Ÿé˜»æ­¢æœªæˆæƒçš„å…¬å…±è®¿é—®
Question #275
âšª å•é€‰é¢˜é«˜çº§
A company is planning to migrate an Amazon RDS for Oracle database to an RDS for PostgreSQL DB instance in another AWS account. A solutions architect needs to design a migration strategy that will require no downtime and that will minimize the amount of time necessary to complete the migration. The migration strategy must replicate all existing data and any new data that is created during the migration. The target database must be identical to the source database at completion of the migration process. All applications currently use an Amazon Route 53 CNAME record as their endpoint for communication with the RDS for Oracle DB instance. The RDS for Oracle DB instance is in a private subnet. Which combination of steps should the solutions architect take to meet these requirements? (Choose three.)
ğŸ·ï¸ Knowledge Tags
AWS Services: RDSVPCRoute53DMS
Knowledge Areas: æ•°æ®åº“ç½‘ç»œæ¶æ„æ¶æ„è®¾è®¡
Scenarios: è¿ç§»ä¸Šäº‘å¤šè´¦æˆ·ç®¡ç†
Exam Domain: Domain1-è®¾è®¡å¼¹æ€§æ¶æ„
Key Concepts: é›¶åœæœºè¿ç§»è·¨è´¦æˆ·æ•°æ®åº“è¿ç§»CDCå…¨é‡åŠ è½½VPCå¯¹ç­‰è¿æ¥
A.
Create a new RDS for PostgreSQL DB instance in the target account. Use the AWS Schema Conversion Tool (AWS SCT) to migrate the database schema from the source database to the target database.
B.
Use the AWS Schema Conversion Tool (AWS SCT) to create a new RDS for PostgreSQL DB instance in the target account with the schema and initial data from the source database.
C.
Configure VPC peering between the VPCs in the two AWS accounts to provide connectivity to both DB instances from the target account. Configure the security groups that are attached to each DB instance to allow traffic on the database port from the VPC in the target account.
D.
Temporarily allow the source DB instance to be publicly accessible to provide connectivity from the VPC in the target account. Configure the security groups that are attached to each DB instance to allow traffic on the database port from the VPC in the target account.
E.
Use AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) in the target account to perform a full load plus change data capture (CDC) migration from the source database to the target database. When the migration is complete, change the CNAME record to point to the target DB instance endpoint.
F.
Use AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) in the target account to perform a change data capture (CDC) migration from the source database to the target database. When the migration is complete, change the CNAME record to point to the target DB instance endpoint.
ğŸ“– é¢˜ç›®ç¿»è¯‘
ä¸€å®¶å…¬å¸è®¡åˆ’å°†Amazon RDS for Oracleæ•°æ®åº“è¿ç§»åˆ°å¦ä¸€ä¸ªAWSè´¦æˆ·ä¸­çš„RDS for PostgreSQL DBå®ä¾‹ã€‚è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆæ¶æ„å¸ˆéœ€è¦è®¾è®¡ä¸€ä¸ªé›¶åœæœºæ—¶é—´ä¸”æœ€å°åŒ–è¿ç§»å®Œæˆæ—¶é—´çš„è¿ç§»ç­–ç•¥ã€‚è¿ç§»ç­–ç•¥å¿…é¡»å¤åˆ¶æ‰€æœ‰ç°æœ‰æ•°æ®å’Œè¿ç§»æœŸé—´åˆ›å»ºçš„æ–°æ•°æ®ã€‚ç›®æ ‡æ•°æ®åº“åœ¨è¿ç§»å®Œæˆæ—¶å¿…é¡»ä¸æºæ•°æ®åº“å®Œå…¨ç›¸åŒã€‚æ‰€æœ‰åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºå½“å‰ä½¿ç”¨Amazon Route 53 CNAMEè®°å½•ä½œä¸ºä¸RDS for Oracle DBå®ä¾‹é€šä¿¡çš„ç«¯ç‚¹ã€‚RDS for Oracle DBå®ä¾‹ä½äºç§æœ‰å­ç½‘ä¸­ã€‚è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆæ¶æ„å¸ˆåº”è¯¥é‡‡å–å“ªäº›æ­¥éª¤ç»„åˆæ¥æ»¡è¶³è¿™äº›è¦æ±‚ï¼Ÿ
ğŸ”¤ é€‰é¡¹ç¿»è¯‘
A. åœ¨ç›®æ ‡è´¦æˆ·ä¸­åˆ›å»ºæ–°çš„RDS for PostgreSQL DBå®ä¾‹ã€‚ä½¿ç”¨AWS SCTå°†æ•°æ®åº“æ¶æ„ä»æºæ•°æ®åº“è¿ç§»åˆ°ç›®æ ‡æ•°æ®åº“ã€‚ B. ä½¿ç”¨AWS SCTåœ¨ç›®æ ‡è´¦æˆ·ä¸­åˆ›å»ºæ–°çš„RDS for PostgreSQL DBå®ä¾‹ï¼ŒåŒ…å«æºæ•°æ®åº“çš„æ¶æ„å’Œåˆå§‹æ•°æ®ã€‚ C. åœ¨ä¸¤ä¸ªAWSè´¦æˆ·çš„VPCä¹‹é—´é…ç½®VPCå¯¹ç­‰è¿æ¥ï¼Œæä¾›ä»ç›®æ ‡è´¦æˆ·åˆ°ä¸¤ä¸ªDBå®ä¾‹çš„è¿æ¥ã€‚é…ç½®å®‰å…¨ç»„å…è®¸ç›®æ ‡è´¦æˆ·VPCçš„æ•°æ®åº“ç«¯å£æµé‡ã€‚ D. ä¸´æ—¶å…è®¸æºDBå®ä¾‹å…¬å¼€è®¿é—®ï¼Œæä¾›ä»ç›®æ ‡è´¦æˆ·VPCçš„è¿æ¥ã€‚é…ç½®å®‰å…¨ç»„å…è®¸ç›®æ ‡è´¦æˆ·VPCçš„æ•°æ®åº“ç«¯å£æµé‡ã€‚ E. åœ¨ç›®æ ‡è´¦æˆ·ä¸­ä½¿ç”¨AWS DMSæ‰§è¡Œå…¨é‡åŠ è½½åŠ å˜æ›´æ•°æ®æ•è·(CDC)è¿ç§»ã€‚è¿ç§»å®Œæˆåï¼Œæ›´æ”¹CNAMEè®°å½•æŒ‡å‘ç›®æ ‡DBå®ä¾‹ç«¯ç‚¹ã€‚ F. åœ¨ç›®æ ‡è´¦æˆ·ä¸­ä½¿ç”¨AWS DMSæ‰§è¡Œå˜æ›´æ•°æ®æ•è·(CDC)è¿ç§»ã€‚è¿ç§»å®Œæˆåï¼Œæ›´æ”¹CNAMEè®°å½•æŒ‡å‘ç›®æ ‡DBå®ä¾‹ç«¯ç‚¹ã€‚
ğŸ¯ æ ¸å¿ƒè¦æ±‚
å®ç°è·¨è´¦æˆ·Oracleåˆ°PostgreSQLçš„é›¶åœæœºæ•°æ®åº“è¿ç§»
âŒ é”™è¯¯é€‰é¡¹åˆ†æ
Bé€‰é¡¹SCTä¸èƒ½ç›´æ¥åˆ›å»ºDBå®ä¾‹ï¼›Dé€‰é¡¹å…¬å¼€è®¿é—®ä¸å®‰å…¨ä¸”ä¸å¿…è¦ï¼›Fé€‰é¡¹ä»…CDCæ— æ³•å®Œæˆå®Œæ•´è¿ç§»
âš–ï¸ å†³ç­–æ ‡å‡†
é›¶åœæœºè¦æ±‚ã€è·¨è´¦æˆ·è¿æ¥ã€å®Œæ•´æ•°æ®è¿ç§»ã€ç½‘ç»œå®‰å…¨æ€§
Question #276
âšª å•é€‰é¢˜ä¸­çº§
A company has implemented an ordering system using an event-driven architecture. During initial testing, the system stopped processing orders. Further log analysis revealed that one order message in an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) standard queue was causing an error on the backend and blocking all subsequent order messages. The visibility timeout of the queue is set to 30 seconds, and the backend processing timeout is set to 10 seconds. A solutions architect needs to analyze faulty order messages and ensure that the system continues to process subsequent messages. Which step should the solutions architect take to meet these requirements?
ğŸ·ï¸ Knowledge Tags
AWS Services: SQS
Knowledge Areas: æ•…éšœæ’é™¤æ¶æ„è®¾è®¡è¿ç»´ç›‘æ§
Scenarios: æ•…éšœè½¬ç§»è´Ÿè½½å‡è¡¡
Exam Domain: Domain1-è®¾è®¡å¼¹æ€§æ¶æ„
Key Concepts: æ­»ä¿¡é˜Ÿåˆ—å¯è§æ€§è¶…æ—¶æ¶ˆæ¯å¤„ç†å¤±è´¥äº‹ä»¶é©±åŠ¨æ¶æ„
A.
Increase the backend processing timeout to 30 seconds to match the visibility timeout.
B.
Reduce the visibility timeout of the queue to automatically remove the faulty message.
C.
Configure a new SQS FIFO queue as a dead-letter queue to isolate the faulty messages.
D.
Configure a new SQS standard queue as a dead-letter queue to isolate the faulty messages.
ğŸ“– é¢˜ç›®ç¿»è¯‘
ä¸€å®¶å…¬å¸ä½¿ç”¨äº‹ä»¶é©±åŠ¨æ¶æ„å®ç°äº†è®¢å•ç³»ç»Ÿã€‚åœ¨åˆå§‹æµ‹è¯•æœŸé—´ï¼Œç³»ç»Ÿåœæ­¢å¤„ç†è®¢å•ã€‚è¿›ä¸€æ­¥çš„æ—¥å¿—åˆ†ææ˜¾ç¤ºï¼ŒAmazon SQSæ ‡å‡†é˜Ÿåˆ—ä¸­çš„ä¸€æ¡è®¢å•æ¶ˆæ¯åœ¨åç«¯å¼•èµ·é”™è¯¯ï¼Œé˜»å¡äº†æ‰€æœ‰åç»­è®¢å•æ¶ˆæ¯ã€‚é˜Ÿåˆ—çš„å¯è§æ€§è¶…æ—¶è®¾ç½®ä¸º30ç§’ï¼Œåç«¯å¤„ç†è¶…æ—¶è®¾ç½®ä¸º10ç§’ã€‚è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆæ¶æ„å¸ˆéœ€è¦åˆ†æé”™è¯¯çš„è®¢å•æ¶ˆæ¯å¹¶ç¡®ä¿ç³»ç»Ÿç»§ç»­å¤„ç†åç»­æ¶ˆæ¯ã€‚
ğŸ”¤ é€‰é¡¹ç¿»è¯‘
A. å°†åç«¯å¤„ç†è¶…æ—¶å¢åŠ åˆ°30ç§’ä»¥åŒ¹é…å¯è§æ€§è¶…æ—¶ B. å‡å°‘é˜Ÿåˆ—çš„å¯è§æ€§è¶…æ—¶ä»¥è‡ªåŠ¨åˆ é™¤é”™è¯¯æ¶ˆæ¯ C. é…ç½®æ–°çš„SQS FIFOé˜Ÿåˆ—ä½œä¸ºæ­»ä¿¡é˜Ÿåˆ—æ¥éš”ç¦»é”™è¯¯æ¶ˆæ¯ D. é…ç½®æ–°çš„SQSæ ‡å‡†é˜Ÿåˆ—ä½œä¸ºæ­»ä¿¡é˜Ÿåˆ—æ¥éš”ç¦»é”™è¯¯æ¶ˆæ¯
ğŸ¯ æ ¸å¿ƒè¦æ±‚
éš”ç¦»é”™è¯¯æ¶ˆæ¯å¹¶ç¡®ä¿ç³»ç»Ÿç»§ç»­å¤„ç†åç»­æ­£å¸¸æ¶ˆæ¯
âŒ é”™è¯¯é€‰é¡¹åˆ†æ
A-ä»…å»¶é•¿å¤„ç†æ—¶é—´ä¸è§£å†³æ ¹æœ¬é—®é¢˜; B-å‡å°‘å¯è§æ€§è¶…æ—¶ä¸ä¼šåˆ é™¤æ¶ˆæ¯; C-FIFOé˜Ÿåˆ—ä½œä¸ºæ­»ä¿¡é˜Ÿåˆ—ä¸é€‚ç”¨äºæ ‡å‡†é˜Ÿåˆ—
âš–ï¸ å†³ç­–æ ‡å‡†
éœ€è¦éš”ç¦»é”™è¯¯æ¶ˆæ¯è€Œä¸å½±å“æ­£å¸¸æ¶ˆæ¯å¤„ç†ï¼Œæ­»ä¿¡é˜Ÿåˆ—ç±»å‹åº”ä¸æºé˜Ÿåˆ—åŒ¹é…
Question #277
âšª å•é€‰é¢˜ä¸­çº§
A company has automated the nightly retraining of its machine learning models by using AWS Step Functions. The workflow consists of multiple steps that use AWS Lambda. Each step can fail for various reasons, and any failure causes a failure of the overall workflow. A review reveals that the retraining has failed multiple nights in a row without the company noticing the failure. A solutions architect needs to improve the workflow so that notifications are sent for all types of failures in the retraining process. Which combination of steps should the solutions architect take to meet these requirements? (Choose three.)
ğŸ·ï¸ Knowledge Tags
AWS Services: LambdaSNSStep-Functions
Knowledge Areas: è¿ç»´ç›‘æ§æ•…éšœæ’é™¤æ— æœåŠ¡å™¨
Scenarios: æ•…éšœè½¬ç§»è‡ªåŠ¨æ‰©å±•
Exam Domain: Domain1-è®¾è®¡å¼¹æ€§æ¶æ„
Key Concepts: Step Functionsé”™è¯¯å¤„ç†Catchå­—æ®µçŠ¶æ€æœºå¼‚å¸¸æ•è·é€šçŸ¥æœºåˆ¶
A.
Create an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic with a subscription of type ""Email"" that targets the team's mailing list.
B.
Create a task named ""Email"" that forwards the input arguments to the SNS topic.
C.
Add a Catch field to all Task, Map, and Parallel states that have a statement of ""ErrorEquals"": [ ""States.ALL"" ] and ""Next"": ""Email"".
D.
Add a new email address to Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES). Verify the email address.
E.
Create a task named ""Email"" that forwards the input arguments to the SES email address.
F.
Add a Catch field to all Task, Map, and Parallel states that have a statement of ""ErrorEquals"": [ ""States.Runtime"" ] and ""Next"": ""Email"". 2024/7/9 18:19 AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional SAP-C02 Exam - Free Exam Q&As, Page 1 | ExamTopics
ğŸ“– é¢˜ç›®ç¿»è¯‘
ä¸€å®¶å…¬å¸ä½¿ç”¨AWS Step Functionsè‡ªåŠ¨åŒ–å…¶æœºå™¨å­¦ä¹ æ¨¡å‹çš„å¤œé—´é‡è®­ç»ƒã€‚å·¥ä½œæµåŒ…å«å¤šä¸ªä½¿ç”¨AWS Lambdaçš„æ­¥éª¤ã€‚æ¯ä¸ªæ­¥éª¤éƒ½å¯èƒ½å› å„ç§åŸå› å¤±è´¥ï¼Œä»»ä½•å¤±è´¥éƒ½ä¼šå¯¼è‡´æ•´ä¸ªå·¥ä½œæµå¤±è´¥ã€‚å®¡æŸ¥å‘ç°é‡è®­ç»ƒå·²è¿ç»­å¤šä¸ªå¤œæ™šå¤±è´¥ï¼Œä½†å…¬å¸æ²¡æœ‰æ³¨æ„åˆ°å¤±è´¥ã€‚è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆæ¶æ„å¸ˆéœ€è¦æ”¹è¿›å·¥ä½œæµï¼Œä»¥ä¾¿ä¸ºé‡è®­ç»ƒè¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­çš„æ‰€æœ‰ç±»å‹å¤±è´¥å‘é€é€šçŸ¥ã€‚æ¶æ„å¸ˆåº”é‡‡å–å“ªäº›æ­¥éª¤ç»„åˆæ¥æ»¡è¶³è¿™äº›è¦æ±‚ï¼Ÿï¼ˆé€‰æ‹©ä¸‰ä¸ªï¼‰
ğŸ”¤ é€‰é¡¹ç¿»è¯‘
A. åˆ›å»ºAmazon SNSä¸»é¢˜ï¼Œè®¢é˜…ç±»å‹ä¸º""Email""ï¼Œç›®æ ‡ä¸ºå›¢é˜Ÿé‚®ä»¶åˆ—è¡¨ B. åˆ›å»ºåä¸º""Email""çš„ä»»åŠ¡ï¼Œå°†è¾“å…¥å‚æ•°è½¬å‘åˆ°SNSä¸»é¢˜ C. ä¸ºæ‰€æœ‰Taskã€Mapå’ŒParallelçŠ¶æ€æ·»åŠ Catchå­—æ®µï¼ŒåŒ…å«""ErrorEquals"": [""States.ALL""]å’Œ""Next"": ""Email"" D. å‘Amazon SESæ·»åŠ æ–°é‚®ç®±åœ°å€å¹¶éªŒè¯ E. åˆ›å»ºåä¸º""Email""çš„ä»»åŠ¡ï¼Œå°†è¾“å…¥å‚æ•°è½¬å‘åˆ°SESé‚®ç®±åœ°å€ F. ä¸ºæ‰€æœ‰Taskã€Mapå’ŒParallelçŠ¶æ€æ·»åŠ Catchå­—æ®µï¼ŒåŒ…å«""ErrorEquals"": [""States.Runtime""]å’Œ""Next"": ""Email""
ğŸ¯ æ ¸å¿ƒè¦æ±‚
ä¸ºStep Functionså·¥ä½œæµä¸­çš„æ‰€æœ‰å¤±è´¥ç±»å‹é…ç½®é€šçŸ¥æœºåˆ¶
âŒ é”™è¯¯é€‰é¡¹åˆ†æ
Då’ŒEä½¿ç”¨SESè€ŒéSNSï¼ˆSNSæ›´é€‚åˆç®€å•é€šçŸ¥ï¼‰ï¼›Fåªæ•è·è¿è¡Œæ—¶é”™è¯¯è€Œéæ‰€æœ‰é”™è¯¯ç±»å‹
âš–ï¸ å†³ç­–æ ‡å‡†
éœ€è¦æ•è·æ‰€æœ‰é”™è¯¯ç±»å‹ï¼ˆStates.ALLï¼‰ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨SNSè¿›è¡Œé‚®ä»¶é€šçŸ¥ï¼Œåˆ›å»ºä¸“é—¨çš„é€šçŸ¥ä»»åŠ¡
Question #278
âšª å•é€‰é¢˜ä¸­çº§
A company plans to deploy a new private intranet service on Amazon EC2 instances inside a VPC. An AWS Site-to-Site VPN connects the VPC to the company's on-premises network. The new service must communicate with existing on-premises services. The on-premises services are accessible through the use of hostnames that reside in the company.example DNS zone. This DNS zone is wholly hosted on premises and is available only on the company's private network. A solutions architect must ensure that the new service can resolve hostnames on the company.example domain to integrate with existing services. Which solution meets these requirements?
ğŸ·ï¸ Knowledge Tags
AWS Services: EC2VPCRoute53Systems-Manager
Knowledge Areas: ç½‘ç»œæ¶æ„æ··åˆäº‘æ¶æ„æ¶æ„è®¾è®¡
Scenarios: æ··åˆäº‘æ¶æ„ç½‘ç»œéš”ç¦»
Exam Domain: Domain1-è®¾è®¡å¼¹æ€§æ¶æ„
Key Concepts: DNSè§£æå‡ºç«™ç«¯ç‚¹æ¡ä»¶è½¬å‘æ··åˆDNSæ¶æ„
A.
Create an empty private zone in Amazon Route 53 for company.example. Add an additional NS record to the company's on-premises company.example zone that points to the authoritative name servers for the new private zone in Route 53.
B.
Turn on DNS hostnames for the VPC. Configure a new outbound endpoint with Amazon Route 53 Resolver. Create a Resolver rule to forward requests for company.example to the on-premises name servers.
C.
Turn on DNS hostnames for the VPC. Configure a new inbound resolver endpoint with Amazon Route 53 Resolver. Configure the on-premises DNS server to forward requests for company.example to the new resolver.
D.
Use AWS Systems Manager to configure a run document that will install a hosts file that contains any required hostnames. Use an Amazon EventBridge rule to run the document when an instance is entering the running state.
ğŸ“– é¢˜ç›®ç¿»è¯‘
ä¸€å®¶å…¬å¸è®¡åˆ’åœ¨VPCå†…çš„Amazon EC2å®ä¾‹ä¸Šéƒ¨ç½²æ–°çš„ç§æœ‰å†…ç½‘æœåŠ¡ã€‚AWS Site-to-Site VPNè¿æ¥VPCåˆ°å…¬å¸æœ¬åœ°ç½‘ç»œã€‚æ–°æœåŠ¡å¿…é¡»ä¸ç°æœ‰æœ¬åœ°æœåŠ¡é€šä¿¡ã€‚æœ¬åœ°æœåŠ¡é€šè¿‡ä½äºcompany.example DNSåŒºåŸŸçš„ä¸»æœºåè®¿é—®ã€‚æ­¤DNSåŒºåŸŸå®Œå…¨æ‰˜ç®¡åœ¨æœ¬åœ°ï¼Œä»…åœ¨å…¬å¸ç§æœ‰ç½‘ç»œä¸Šå¯ç”¨ã€‚è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆæ¶æ„å¸ˆå¿…é¡»ç¡®ä¿æ–°æœåŠ¡èƒ½å¤Ÿè§£æcompany.exampleåŸŸä¸Šçš„ä¸»æœºåä»¥ä¸ç°æœ‰æœåŠ¡é›†æˆã€‚
ğŸ”¤ é€‰é¡¹ç¿»è¯‘
A. åœ¨Amazon Route 53ä¸­ä¸ºcompany.exampleåˆ›å»ºç©ºçš„ç§æœ‰åŒºåŸŸã€‚å‘å…¬å¸æœ¬åœ°company.exampleåŒºåŸŸæ·»åŠ é¢å¤–çš„NSè®°å½•ï¼ŒæŒ‡å‘Route 53ä¸­æ–°ç§æœ‰åŒºåŸŸçš„æƒå¨åç§°æœåŠ¡å™¨ã€‚ B. ä¸ºVPCå¯ç”¨DNSä¸»æœºåã€‚é…ç½®Amazon Route 53 Resolverçš„æ–°å‡ºç«™ç«¯ç‚¹ã€‚åˆ›å»ºResolverè§„åˆ™å°†company.exampleè¯·æ±‚è½¬å‘åˆ°æœ¬åœ°åç§°æœåŠ¡å™¨ã€‚ C. ä¸ºVPCå¯ç”¨DNSä¸»æœºåã€‚é…ç½®Amazon Route 53 Resolverçš„æ–°å…¥ç«™è§£æç«¯ç‚¹ã€‚é…ç½®æœ¬åœ°DNSæœåŠ¡å™¨å°†company.exampleè¯·æ±‚è½¬å‘åˆ°æ–°è§£æå™¨ã€‚ D. ä½¿ç”¨AWS Systems Manageré…ç½®è¿è¡Œæ–‡æ¡£ï¼Œå®‰è£…åŒ…å«æ‰€éœ€ä¸»æœºåçš„hostsæ–‡ä»¶ã€‚ä½¿ç”¨Amazon EventBridgeè§„åˆ™åœ¨å®ä¾‹è¿›å…¥è¿è¡ŒçŠ¶æ€æ—¶è¿è¡Œæ–‡æ¡£ã€‚
ğŸ¯ æ ¸å¿ƒè¦æ±‚
ä½¿VPCå†…EC2å®ä¾‹èƒ½å¤Ÿè§£ææœ¬åœ°DNSåŒºåŸŸçš„ä¸»æœºå
âŒ é”™è¯¯é€‰é¡¹åˆ†æ
A-NSè®°å½•æ–¹å‘é”™è¯¯ä¸”ä¸é€‚ç”¨äºç§æœ‰ç½‘ç»œï¼›C-å…¥ç«™ç«¯ç‚¹ç”¨äºç›¸åæ–¹å‘çš„DNSè§£æï¼›D-é™æ€hostsæ–‡ä»¶æ— æ³•åŠ¨æ€æ›´æ–°ä¸”ç»´æŠ¤å¤æ‚
âš–ï¸ å†³ç­–æ ‡å‡†
DNSæŸ¥è¯¢æ–¹å‘ï¼ˆä»AWSåˆ°æœ¬åœ°ï¼‰å’ŒRoute 53 Resolverçš„æ­£ç¡®é…ç½®æ–¹å¼
Question #279
âšª å•é€‰é¢˜ä¸­çº§
A company uses AWS CloudFormation to deploy applications within multiple VPCs that are all attached to a transit gateway. Each VPC that sends traffic to the public internet must send the traffic through a shared services VPC. Each subnet within a VPC uses the default VPC route table, and the traffic is routed to the transit gateway. The transit gateway uses its default route table for any VPC attachment. A security audit reveals that an Amazon EC2 instance that is deployed within a VPC can communicate with an EC2 instance that is deployed in any of the company's other VPCs. A solutions architect needs to limit the traffic between the VPCs. Each VPC must be able to communicate only with a predefined, limited set of authorized VPCs. What should the solutions architect do to meet these requirements?
ğŸ·ï¸ Knowledge Tags
AWS Services: VPCEC2CloudFormation
Knowledge Areas: ç½‘ç»œæ¶æ„å®‰å…¨æ€§
Scenarios: ç½‘ç»œéš”ç¦»æƒé™æ§åˆ¶
Exam Domain: Domain3-è®¾è®¡å®‰å…¨åº”ç”¨å’Œæ¶æ„
Key Concepts: Transit Gatewayè·¯ç”±è¡¨VPCè·¯ç”±æ§åˆ¶ç½‘ç»œåˆ†æ®µæµé‡éš”ç¦»
A.
Update the network ACL of each subnet within a VPC to allow outbound traffic only to the authorized VPCs. Remove all deny rules except the default deny rule.
B.
Update all the security groups that are used within a VPC to deny outbound traffic to security groups that are used within the unauthorized VPCs.
C.
Create a dedicated transit gateway route table for each VPC attachment. Route traffic only to the authorized VPCs.
D.
Update the main route table of each VPC to route traffic only to the authorized VPCs through the transit gateway.
ğŸ“– é¢˜ç›®ç¿»è¯‘
ä¸€å®¶å…¬å¸ä½¿ç”¨AWS CloudFormationåœ¨å¤šä¸ªVPCä¸­éƒ¨ç½²åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºï¼Œæ‰€æœ‰VPCéƒ½è¿æ¥åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªtransit gatewayã€‚æ¯ä¸ªå‘å…¬ç½‘å‘é€æµé‡çš„VPCéƒ½å¿…é¡»é€šè¿‡å…±äº«æœåŠ¡VPCå‘é€æµé‡ã€‚VPCå†…çš„æ¯ä¸ªå­ç½‘ä½¿ç”¨é»˜è®¤VPCè·¯ç”±è¡¨ï¼Œæµé‡è·¯ç”±åˆ°transit gatewayã€‚Transit gatewayå¯¹ä»»ä½•VPC attachmentä½¿ç”¨é»˜è®¤è·¯ç”±è¡¨ã€‚å®‰å…¨å®¡è®¡å‘ç°éƒ¨ç½²åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªVPCä¸­çš„EC2å®ä¾‹å¯ä»¥ä¸éƒ¨ç½²åœ¨å…¬å¸ä»»ä½•å…¶ä»–VPCä¸­çš„EC2å®ä¾‹é€šä¿¡ã€‚è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆæ¶æ„å¸ˆéœ€è¦é™åˆ¶VPCä¹‹é—´çš„æµé‡ï¼Œæ¯ä¸ªVPCåªèƒ½ä¸é¢„å®šä¹‰çš„ã€æœ‰é™çš„æˆæƒVPCé›†åˆé€šä¿¡ã€‚
ğŸ”¤ é€‰é¡¹ç¿»è¯‘
A. æ›´æ–°VPCå†…æ¯ä¸ªå­ç½‘çš„network ACLï¼Œåªå…è®¸å‡ºç«™æµé‡åˆ°æˆæƒçš„VPCï¼Œé™¤é»˜è®¤æ‹’ç»è§„åˆ™å¤–åˆ é™¤æ‰€æœ‰æ‹’ç»è§„åˆ™ B. æ›´æ–°VPCå†…ä½¿ç”¨çš„æ‰€æœ‰security groupï¼Œæ‹’ç»åˆ°æœªæˆæƒVPCå†…security groupçš„å‡ºç«™æµé‡ C. ä¸ºæ¯ä¸ªVPC attachmentåˆ›å»ºä¸“ç”¨çš„transit gatewayè·¯ç”±è¡¨ï¼Œåªè·¯ç”±æµé‡åˆ°æˆæƒçš„VPC D. æ›´æ–°æ¯ä¸ªVPCçš„ä¸»è·¯ç”±è¡¨ï¼Œåªé€šè¿‡transit gatewayè·¯ç”±æµé‡åˆ°æˆæƒçš„VPC
ğŸ¯ æ ¸å¿ƒè¦æ±‚
é™åˆ¶VPCé—´é€šä¿¡ï¼Œå®ç°ç½‘ç»œåˆ†æ®µå’Œè®¿é—®æ§åˆ¶
âŒ é”™è¯¯é€‰é¡¹åˆ†æ
Aé€‰é¡¹Network ACLæ— æ³•åŸºäºç›®æ ‡VPCè¿›è¡Œè¿‡æ»¤ï¼›Bé€‰é¡¹Security Groupæ— æ³•è·¨VPCå¼•ç”¨ï¼›Dé€‰é¡¹VPCè·¯ç”±è¡¨åªèƒ½æ§åˆ¶æœ¬VPCçš„è·¯ç”±ï¼Œæ— æ³•é™åˆ¶å…¶ä»–VPCå¯¹æœ¬VPCçš„è®¿é—®ã€‚
âš–ï¸ å†³ç­–æ ‡å‡†
éœ€è¦åœ¨transit gatewayå±‚é¢å®ç°åŒå‘æµé‡æ§åˆ¶ï¼Œåªæœ‰ä¸“ç”¨è·¯ç”±è¡¨èƒ½å¤Ÿç²¾ç¡®æ§åˆ¶VPCé—´çš„é€šä¿¡è·¯å¾„ã€‚
Question #280
âšª å•é€‰é¢˜ä¸­çº§
A company has a Windows-based desktop application that is packaged and deployed to the users' Windows machines. The company recently acquired another company that has employees who primarily use machines with a Linux operating system. The acquiring company has decided to migrate and rehost the Windows-based desktop application to AWS. All employees must be authenticated before they use the application. The acquiring company uses Active Directory on premises but wants a simplified way to manage access to the application on AWS for all the employees. Which solution will rehost the application on AWS with the LEAST development effort?
ğŸ·ï¸ Knowledge Tags
AWS Services: EC2ECSFargateAuto-Scaling
Knowledge Areas: è®¡ç®—æœåŠ¡èº«ä»½ç®¡ç†æ¶æ„è®¾è®¡
Scenarios: è¿ç§»ä¸Šäº‘æ··åˆäº‘æ¶æ„
Exam Domain: Domain1-è®¾è®¡å¼¹æ€§æ¶æ„
Key Concepts: åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºæµå¼ä¼ è¾“æ¡Œé¢è™šæ‹ŸåŒ–å®¹å™¨åŒ–èº«ä»½éªŒè¯
A.
Set up and provision an Amazon WorkSpaces virtual desktop for every employee. Implement authentication by using Amazon Cognito identity pools. Instruct employees to run the application from their provisioned WorkSpaces virtual desktops.
B.
Create an Auto Scaling group of Windows-based Amazon EC2 instances. Join each EC2 instance to the company's Active Directory domain. Implement authentication by using the Active Directory that is running on premises. Instruct employees to run the application by using a Windows remote desktop.
C.
Use an Amazon AppStream 2.0 image builder to create an image that includes the application and the required configurations. Provision an AppStream 2.0 On-Demand fleet with dynamic Fleet Auto Scaling policies for running the image. Implement authentication by using AppStream 2.0 user pools. Instruct the employees to access the application by starting browser-based AppStream 2.0 streaming sessions.
D.
Refactor and containerize the application to run as a web-based application. Run the application in Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) on AWS Fargate with step scaling policies. Implement authentication by using Amazon Cognito user pools. Instruct the employees to run the application from their browsers.
ğŸ“– é¢˜ç›®ç¿»è¯‘
ä¸€å®¶å…¬å¸æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªåŸºäºWindowsçš„æ¡Œé¢åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºï¼Œæ‰“åŒ…éƒ¨ç½²åˆ°ç”¨æˆ·çš„Windowsæœºå™¨ä¸Šã€‚è¯¥å…¬å¸æœ€è¿‘æ”¶è´­äº†å¦ä¸€å®¶å…¬å¸ï¼Œå…¶å‘˜å·¥ä¸»è¦ä½¿ç”¨Linuxæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿçš„æœºå™¨ã€‚æ”¶è´­æ–¹å†³å®šå°†Windowsæ¡Œé¢åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºè¿ç§»å¹¶é‡æ–°æ‰˜ç®¡åˆ°AWSã€‚æ‰€æœ‰å‘˜å·¥åœ¨ä½¿ç”¨åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºå‰å¿…é¡»è¿›è¡Œèº«ä»½éªŒè¯ã€‚æ”¶è´­æ–¹åœ¨æœ¬åœ°ä½¿ç”¨Active Directoryï¼Œä½†å¸Œæœ›ä¸ºAWSä¸Šçš„æ‰€æœ‰å‘˜å·¥æä¾›ç®€åŒ–çš„åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºè®¿é—®ç®¡ç†æ–¹å¼ã€‚å“ªç§è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆèƒ½ä»¥æœ€å°‘çš„å¼€å‘å·¥ä½œé‡å°†åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºé‡æ–°æ‰˜ç®¡åˆ°AWSï¼Ÿ
ğŸ”¤ é€‰é¡¹ç¿»è¯‘
A. ä¸ºæ¯ä¸ªå‘˜å·¥è®¾ç½®å’Œé…ç½®Amazon WorkSpacesè™šæ‹Ÿæ¡Œé¢ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨Amazon Cognitoèº«ä»½æ± å®ç°èº«ä»½éªŒè¯ï¼ŒæŒ‡å¯¼å‘˜å·¥ä»WorkSpacesè™šæ‹Ÿæ¡Œé¢è¿è¡Œåº”ç”¨ç¨‹åº B. åˆ›å»ºåŸºäºWindowsçš„Amazon EC2å®ä¾‹Auto Scalingç»„ï¼Œå°†æ¯ä¸ªEC2å®ä¾‹åŠ å…¥å…¬å¸çš„Active DirectoryåŸŸï¼Œä½¿ç”¨æœ¬åœ°Active Directoryå®ç°èº«ä»½éªŒè¯ï¼ŒæŒ‡å¯¼å‘˜å·¥é€šè¿‡Windowsè¿œç¨‹æ¡Œé¢è¿è¡Œåº”ç”¨ç¨‹åº C. ä½¿ç”¨Amazon AppStream 2.0é•œåƒæ„å»ºå™¨åˆ›å»ºåŒ…å«åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºå’Œæ‰€éœ€é…ç½®çš„é•œåƒï¼Œé…ç½®å¸¦æœ‰åŠ¨æ€Fleet Auto Scalingç­–ç•¥çš„AppStream 2.0æŒ‰éœ€é˜Ÿåˆ—è¿è¡Œé•œåƒï¼Œä½¿ç”¨AppStream 2.0ç”¨æˆ·æ± å®ç°èº«ä»½éªŒè¯ï¼ŒæŒ‡å¯¼å‘˜å·¥é€šè¿‡åŸºäºæµè§ˆå™¨çš„AppStream 2.0æµå¼ä¼šè¯è®¿é—®åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åº D. é‡æ„å¹¶å®¹å™¨åŒ–åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºä»¥ä½œä¸ºWebåº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºè¿è¡Œï¼Œåœ¨AWS Fargateä¸Šçš„Amazon ECSä¸­è¿è¡Œåº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºå¹¶é…ç½®æ­¥è¿›æ‰©å±•ç­–ç•¥ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨Amazon Cognitoç”¨æˆ·æ± å®ç°èº«ä»½éªŒè¯ï¼ŒæŒ‡å¯¼å‘˜å·¥ä»æµè§ˆå™¨è¿è¡Œåº”ç”¨ç¨‹åº
ğŸ¯ æ ¸å¿ƒè¦æ±‚
ä»¥æœ€å°‘å¼€å‘å·¥ä½œé‡å°†Windowsæ¡Œé¢åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºé‡æ–°æ‰˜ç®¡åˆ°AWSå¹¶æ”¯æŒè·¨å¹³å°è®¿é—®
âŒ é”™è¯¯é€‰é¡¹åˆ†æ
Aéœ€è¦ä¸ºæ¯ä¸ªç”¨æˆ·é…ç½®è™šæ‹Ÿæ¡Œé¢æˆæœ¬é«˜ï¼›Båªæ”¯æŒWindowsè¿œç¨‹æ¡Œé¢ä¸é€‚åˆLinuxç”¨æˆ·ï¼›Déœ€è¦é‡æ„åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºå¼€å‘å·¥ä½œé‡å¤§
âš–ï¸ å†³ç­–æ ‡å‡†
æœ€å°‘å¼€å‘å·¥ä½œé‡, è·¨å¹³å°å…¼å®¹æ€§, ç°æœ‰åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºé‡ç”¨
Question #281
âšª å•é€‰é¢˜ä¸­çº§
A company is collecting a large amount of data from a fleet of IoT devices. Data is stored as Optimized Row Columnar (ORC) files in the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) on a persistent Amazon EMR cluster. The company's data analytics team queries the data by using SQL in Apache Presto deployed on the same EMR cluster. Queries scan large amounts of data, always run for less than 15 minutes, and run only between 5 PM and 10 PM. The company is concerned about the high cost associated with the current solution. A solutions architect must propose the most cost-effective solution that will allow SQL data queries. Which solution will meet these requirements?
ğŸ·ï¸ Knowledge Tags
AWS Services: S3EMRRedshiftAthenaGlue
Knowledge Areas: æˆæœ¬ä¼˜åŒ–æ•°æ®åº“å­˜å‚¨ç®¡ç†
Scenarios: æˆæœ¬åˆ†ææ€§èƒ½è°ƒä¼˜
Exam Domain: Domain4-è®¾è®¡æˆæœ¬ä¼˜åŒ–æ¶æ„
Key Concepts: æŒ‰éœ€æŸ¥è¯¢æ— æœåŠ¡å™¨åˆ†æORCæ–‡ä»¶æ ¼å¼æˆæœ¬ä¼˜åŒ–SQLæŸ¥è¯¢
A.
Store data in Amazon S3. Use Amazon Redshift Spectrum to query data.
B.
Store data in Amazon S3. Use the AWS Glue Data Catalog and Amazon Athena to query data.
C.
Store data in EMR File System (EMRFS). Use Presto in Amazon EMR to query data.
D.
Store data in Amazon Redshift. Use Amazon Redshift to query data.
ğŸ“– é¢˜ç›®ç¿»è¯‘
ä¸€å®¶å…¬å¸æ­£åœ¨ä»IoTè®¾å¤‡ç¾¤æ”¶é›†å¤§é‡æ•°æ®ã€‚æ•°æ®ä»¥ORCæ–‡ä»¶æ ¼å¼å­˜å‚¨åœ¨æŒä¹…Amazon EMRé›†ç¾¤çš„HDFSä¸­ã€‚æ•°æ®åˆ†æå›¢é˜Ÿä½¿ç”¨éƒ¨ç½²åœ¨åŒä¸€EMRé›†ç¾¤ä¸Šçš„Apache Prestoé€šè¿‡SQLæŸ¥è¯¢æ•°æ®ã€‚æŸ¥è¯¢æ‰«æå¤§é‡æ•°æ®ï¼Œè¿è¡Œæ—¶é—´æ€»æ˜¯å°‘äº15åˆ†é’Ÿï¼Œä¸”ä»…åœ¨ä¸‹åˆ5ç‚¹åˆ°10ç‚¹ä¹‹é—´è¿è¡Œã€‚å…¬å¸æ‹…å¿ƒå½“å‰è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆçš„é«˜æˆæœ¬ã€‚è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆæ¶æ„å¸ˆå¿…é¡»æå‡ºæœ€å…·æˆæœ¬æ•ˆç›Šçš„è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆæ¥æ”¯æŒSQLæ•°æ®æŸ¥è¯¢ã€‚
ğŸ”¤ é€‰é¡¹ç¿»è¯‘
A. å°†æ•°æ®å­˜å‚¨åœ¨S3ä¸­ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨Redshift SpectrumæŸ¥è¯¢æ•°æ® B. å°†æ•°æ®å­˜å‚¨åœ¨S3ä¸­ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨AWS Glue Data Catalogå’ŒAthenaæŸ¥è¯¢æ•°æ® C. å°†æ•°æ®å­˜å‚¨åœ¨EMRFSä¸­ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨EMRä¸­çš„PrestoæŸ¥è¯¢æ•°æ® D. å°†æ•°æ®å­˜å‚¨åœ¨Redshiftä¸­ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨RedshiftæŸ¥è¯¢æ•°æ®
ğŸ¯ æ ¸å¿ƒè¦æ±‚
ä¸ºé—´æ­‡æ€§å¤§æ•°æ®SQLæŸ¥è¯¢æ‰¾åˆ°æœ€å…·æˆæœ¬æ•ˆç›Šçš„è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆ
âŒ é”™è¯¯é€‰é¡¹åˆ†æ
Aé€‰é¡¹Redshift Spectruméœ€è¦Redshifté›†ç¾¤è¿è¡Œæˆæœ¬é«˜ï¼›Cé€‰é¡¹ä»ä½¿ç”¨EMRé›†ç¾¤æˆæœ¬é«˜ï¼›Dé€‰é¡¹Redshiftéœ€è¦æŒç»­è¿è¡Œä¸”æ•°æ®åŠ è½½å¤æ‚æˆæœ¬æœ€é«˜ã€‚
âš–ï¸ å†³ç­–æ ‡å‡†
æŸ¥è¯¢é¢‘ç‡ä½(æ¯å¤©5å°æ—¶)ã€æ— æœåŠ¡å™¨æ¶æ„ã€æŒ‰ä½¿ç”¨ä»˜è´¹æ¨¡å¼ã€æ”¯æŒORCæ ¼å¼
Question #282
âšª å•é€‰é¢˜ä¸­çº§
A large company recently experienced an unexpected increase in Amazon RDS and Amazon DynamoDB costs. The company needs to increase visibility into details of AWS Billing and Cost Management. There are various accounts associated with AWS Organizations, including many development and production accounts. There is no consistent tagging strategy across the organization, but there are guidelines in place that require all infrastructure to be deployed using AWS CloudFormation with consistent tagging. Management requires cost center numbers and project ID numbers for all existing and future DynamoDB tables and RDS instances. Which strategy should the solutions architect provide to meet these requirements?
ğŸ·ï¸ Knowledge Tags
AWS Services: RDSDynamoDBCloudFormationConfigLambdaIAM
Knowledge Areas: æˆæœ¬ä¼˜åŒ–è¿ç»´ç›‘æ§åˆè§„æ€§
Scenarios: å¤šè´¦æˆ·ç®¡ç†æˆæœ¬åˆ†æ
Exam Domain: Domain4-è®¾è®¡æˆæœ¬ä¼˜åŒ–æ¶æ„
Key Concepts: æˆæœ¬åˆ†é…æ ‡ç­¾æ ‡ç­¾ç­–ç•¥æœåŠ¡æ§åˆ¶ç­–ç•¥è·¨è´¦æˆ·ç®¡ç†
A.
Use Tag Editor to tag existing resources. Create cost allocation tags to define the cost center and project ID and allow 24 hours for tags to propagate to existing resources.
B.
Use an AWS Config rule to alert the finance team of untagged resources. Create a centralized AWS Lambda based solution to tag untagged RDS databases and DynamoDB resources every hour using a cross-account role.
C.
Use Tag Editor to tag existing resources. Create cost allocation tags to define the cost center and project ID. Use SCPs to restrict resource creation that do not have the cost center and project ID on the resource.
D.
Create cost allocation tags to define the cost center and project ID and allow 24 hours for tags to propagate to existing resources. Update existing federated roles to restrict privileges to provision resources that do not include the cost center and project ID on the resource.
ğŸ“– é¢˜ç›®ç¿»è¯‘
ä¸€å®¶å¤§å…¬å¸æœ€è¿‘ç»å†äº†Amazon RDSå’ŒAmazon DynamoDBæˆæœ¬çš„æ„å¤–å¢é•¿ã€‚å…¬å¸éœ€è¦æé«˜å¯¹AWS Billing and Cost Managementè¯¦ç»†ä¿¡æ¯çš„å¯è§æ€§ã€‚AWS Organizationså…³è”äº†å¤šä¸ªè´¦æˆ·ï¼ŒåŒ…æ‹¬è®¸å¤šå¼€å‘å’Œç”Ÿäº§è´¦æˆ·ã€‚æ•´ä¸ªç»„ç»‡æ²¡æœ‰ä¸€è‡´çš„æ ‡ç­¾ç­–ç•¥ï¼Œä½†æœ‰æŒ‡å¯¼åŸåˆ™è¦æ±‚æ‰€æœ‰åŸºç¡€è®¾æ–½éƒ½ä½¿ç”¨AWS CloudFormationéƒ¨ç½²å¹¶ä¿æŒä¸€è‡´çš„æ ‡ç­¾ã€‚ç®¡ç†å±‚è¦æ±‚æ‰€æœ‰ç°æœ‰å’Œæœªæ¥çš„DynamoDBè¡¨å’ŒRDSå®ä¾‹éƒ½è¦æœ‰æˆæœ¬ä¸­å¿ƒç¼–å·å’Œé¡¹ç›®IDç¼–å·ã€‚è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆæ¶æ„å¸ˆåº”è¯¥æä¾›ä»€ä¹ˆç­–ç•¥æ¥æ»¡è¶³è¿™äº›è¦æ±‚ï¼Ÿ
ğŸ”¤ é€‰é¡¹ç¿»è¯‘
A. ä½¿ç”¨Tag Editoræ ‡è®°ç°æœ‰èµ„æºã€‚åˆ›å»ºæˆæœ¬åˆ†é…æ ‡ç­¾å®šä¹‰æˆæœ¬ä¸­å¿ƒå’Œé¡¹ç›®IDï¼Œç­‰å¾…24å°æ—¶è®©æ ‡ç­¾ä¼ æ’­åˆ°ç°æœ‰èµ„æº B. ä½¿ç”¨AWS Configè§„åˆ™æé†’è´¢åŠ¡å›¢é˜Ÿæœªæ ‡è®°çš„èµ„æºã€‚åˆ›å»ºåŸºäºAWS Lambdaçš„é›†ä¸­è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆï¼Œä½¿ç”¨è·¨è´¦æˆ·è§’è‰²æ¯å°æ—¶æ ‡è®°æœªæ ‡è®°çš„RDSæ•°æ®åº“å’ŒDynamoDBèµ„æº C. ä½¿ç”¨Tag Editoræ ‡è®°ç°æœ‰èµ„æºã€‚åˆ›å»ºæˆæœ¬åˆ†é…æ ‡ç­¾å®šä¹‰æˆæœ¬ä¸­å¿ƒå’Œé¡¹ç›®IDã€‚ä½¿ç”¨SCPé™åˆ¶åˆ›å»ºæ²¡æœ‰æˆæœ¬ä¸­å¿ƒå’Œé¡¹ç›®IDçš„èµ„æº D. åˆ›å»ºæˆæœ¬åˆ†é…æ ‡ç­¾å®šä¹‰æˆæœ¬ä¸­å¿ƒå’Œé¡¹ç›®IDï¼Œç­‰å¾…24å°æ—¶è®©æ ‡ç­¾ä¼ æ’­åˆ°ç°æœ‰èµ„æºã€‚æ›´æ–°ç°æœ‰è”åˆè§’è‰²ä»¥é™åˆ¶é…ç½®ä¸åŒ…å«æˆæœ¬ä¸­å¿ƒå’Œé¡¹ç›®IDçš„èµ„æºçš„æƒé™
ğŸ¯ æ ¸å¿ƒè¦æ±‚
ä¸ºå¤šè´¦æˆ·ç¯å¢ƒä¸­çš„RDSå’ŒDynamoDBèµ„æºå»ºç«‹ç»Ÿä¸€çš„æˆæœ¬è¿½è¸ªæ ‡ç­¾ç­–ç•¥
âŒ é”™è¯¯é€‰é¡¹åˆ†æ
Aç¼ºå°‘å¼ºåˆ¶æ‰§è¡Œæœºåˆ¶ï¼›Bè¿‡äºå¤æ‚ä¸”è‡ªåŠ¨åŒ–æ ‡è®°å¯èƒ½ä¸å‡†ç¡®ï¼›Dä¸­è”åˆè§’è‰²æ— æ³•æœ‰æ•ˆæ§åˆ¶æ‰€æœ‰è´¦æˆ·çš„èµ„æºåˆ›å»º
âš–ï¸ å†³ç­–æ ‡å‡†
éœ€è¦åŒæ—¶è§£å†³ç°æœ‰èµ„æºæ ‡è®°å’Œæœªæ¥èµ„æºå¼ºåˆ¶æ ‡è®°ä¸¤ä¸ªé—®é¢˜ï¼ŒSCPæ˜¯ç»„ç»‡çº§åˆ«ç­–ç•¥æ§åˆ¶çš„æœ€ä½³é€‰æ‹©
Question #283
âšª å•é€‰é¢˜é«˜çº§
A company wants to send data from its on-premises systems to Amazon S3 buckets. The company created the S3 buckets in three different accounts. The company must send the data privately without the data traveling across the internet. The company has no existing dedicated connectivity to AWS. Which combination of steps should a solutions architect take to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
ğŸ·ï¸ Knowledge Tags
AWS Services: VPCS3Direct-Connect
Knowledge Areas: ç½‘ç»œæ¶æ„å®‰å…¨æ€§æ¶æ„è®¾è®¡
Scenarios: æ··åˆäº‘æ¶æ„å¤šè´¦æˆ·ç®¡ç†
Exam Domain: Domain1-è®¾è®¡å¼¹æ€§æ¶æ„
Key Concepts: ç§æœ‰è¿æ¥VIFç±»å‹VPCç«¯ç‚¹è·¨è´¦æˆ·è®¿é—®
A.
Establish a networking account in the AWS Cloud. Create a private VPC in the networking account. Set up an AWS Direct Connect connection with a private VIF between the on-premises environment and the private VPC.
B.
Establish a networking account in the AWS Cloud. Create a private VPC in the networking account. Set up an AWS Direct Connect connection with a public VIF between the on-premises environment and the private VPC.
C.
Create an Amazon S3 interface endpoint in the networking account.
D.
Create an Amazon S3 gateway endpoint in the networking account.
E.
Establish a networking account in the AWS Cloud. Create a private VPC in the networking account. Peer VPCs from the accounts that host the S3 buckets with the VPC in the networking account. 2024/7/9 18:19 AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional SAP-C02 Exam - Free Exam Q&As, Page 1 | ExamTopics
ğŸ“– é¢˜ç›®ç¿»è¯‘
ä¸€å®¶å…¬å¸å¸Œæœ›å°†æ•°æ®ä»æœ¬åœ°ç³»ç»Ÿå‘é€åˆ°Amazon S3å­˜å‚¨æ¡¶ã€‚å…¬å¸åœ¨ä¸‰ä¸ªä¸åŒè´¦æˆ·ä¸­åˆ›å»ºäº†S3å­˜å‚¨æ¡¶ã€‚å…¬å¸å¿…é¡»ç§å¯†å‘é€æ•°æ®ï¼Œä¸èƒ½é€šè¿‡äº’è”ç½‘ä¼ è¾“ã€‚å…¬å¸ç›®å‰æ²¡æœ‰åˆ°AWSçš„ä¸“ç”¨è¿æ¥ã€‚è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆæ¶æ„å¸ˆåº”è¯¥é‡‡å–å“ªäº›æ­¥éª¤ç»„åˆæ¥æ»¡è¶³è¿™äº›è¦æ±‚ï¼Ÿï¼ˆé€‰æ‹©ä¸¤ä¸ªï¼‰
ğŸ”¤ é€‰é¡¹ç¿»è¯‘
A. åœ¨AWSäº‘ä¸­å»ºç«‹ç½‘ç»œè´¦æˆ·ï¼Œåˆ›å»ºç§æœ‰VPCï¼Œåœ¨æœ¬åœ°ç¯å¢ƒå’Œç§æœ‰VPCä¹‹é—´å»ºç«‹å¸¦ç§æœ‰VIFçš„Direct Connectè¿æ¥ B. åœ¨AWSäº‘ä¸­å»ºç«‹ç½‘ç»œè´¦æˆ·ï¼Œåˆ›å»ºç§æœ‰VPCï¼Œåœ¨æœ¬åœ°ç¯å¢ƒå’Œç§æœ‰VPCä¹‹é—´å»ºç«‹å¸¦å…¬å…±VIFçš„Direct Connectè¿æ¥ C. åœ¨ç½‘ç»œè´¦æˆ·ä¸­åˆ›å»ºAmazon S3æ¥å£ç«¯ç‚¹ D. åœ¨ç½‘ç»œè´¦æˆ·ä¸­åˆ›å»ºAmazon S3ç½‘å…³ç«¯ç‚¹ E. å»ºç«‹ç½‘ç»œè´¦æˆ·ï¼Œåˆ›å»ºç§æœ‰VPCï¼Œå°†æ‰˜ç®¡S3å­˜å‚¨æ¡¶çš„è´¦æˆ·VPCä¸ç½‘ç»œè´¦æˆ·VPCå¯¹ç­‰è¿æ¥
ğŸ¯ æ ¸å¿ƒè¦æ±‚

âŒ é”™è¯¯é€‰é¡¹åˆ†æ
Bé€‰é¡¹å…¬å…±VIFä¸ç¬¦åˆç§æœ‰è¦æ±‚ï¼›Cé€‰é¡¹æ¥å£ç«¯ç‚¹ä¸é€‚ç”¨äºS3ï¼›Eé€‰é¡¹VPCå¯¹ç­‰æ— æ³•ç›´æ¥è®¿é—®S3
âš–ï¸ å†³ç­–æ ‡å‡†
